message_1: What is the time complexity of an algorithm that takes 5 seconds to solve a problem of size 100 and takes 10 seconds to solve a problem of size 200? Calculate the Big-O notation for this algorithm.
message_2:
To determine the time complexity, we can compare the time taken for different problem sizes. 

For size 100, the algorithm takes 5 seconds.
For size 200, the algorithm takes 10 seconds.

Notice that when the problem size doubles, the time taken also doubles. This suggests that the algorithm has a linear time complexity. Therefore, the Big-O notation for this algorithm is O(n), where n is the problem size.
